text: <!channel> This looks like a great event. Good opp to represent Uncorked and give back to the community. <http://www.designlikemadpdx.org/>
I signed up last night and it looks like they still need designers and devs.
Reminds me of a game jam. Wonder if a game designer would be useful here...
These are some of their projects from last year to give you an idea what gets done here. <http://www.designlikemad.org/projects>
What a great op to work with nonprofits.
We should seriously consider it. Something anyone is interested in?
anyone know of any office supplies that are needed in the studio?
pens
<!channel> whoever's the administrator of our Trello should take note: <https://trello.com/5m>

<!channel> - I just returned from a morning of planning for the next year of U of O. They've got some really interesting stuff going on, not the least of which is the UO Center for Journalism Innovation and Civic Engagement. The founder of that center is ex-NY Times Digital Director Andrew DeVigal. During his speech today, he unveiled this video, prominently featuring Marcelino. 

<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PhRfgZt6Jpw>

He went on, in a Q&A session with the entire college of Journalism, to mention Uncorked Studios as a shining example of community partnership in design and technology. 

It was a really proud moment to be part of, and a huge deal as the UofO moves into uncharted territory as a school. Think of his work as akin to Samsung's PIT group — the skunkworks people who can actually produce change. His point in bringing up Uncorked is that the university needs people/places like us to reimagine education in and the field of journalism itself.
in short, it was pretty great.
thanks for sharing
awesome!

attachments.title: Kanye Scores 106 Points Against Wheelchair Basketball Team
attachments.text: A charity basketball game didn’t go exactly as planned yesterday when Kanye West scored 106 points against a team of handicapped children in wheelchairs. The game was a PR move intended to smooth over the controversy that erupted this week between Kanye and the disabled community. At one of ...
attachments.fallback: The Daily Currant: Kanye Scores 106 Points Against Wheelchair Basketball Team

iOS 8 has a cool predictive keyboard, using NLP to guess what word might be next. Starting with an empty text box I did a little experiment using just the first predicted word over and over again
A file was shared

now who are you gonna send that to?

It's like spam poetry!
<@U02AVBGQC> It's mostly a matter of training a hidden Markov model on a more comprehensive data set, I think.
I had a lot of fun in an NLP class in college. Easily my favorite of the programming disciplines
I worked for a summer doing NLP in Python for a gov't contractor. One of my favorite things I've ever programmed
<@U02918BKW> <@U02F8LF2X> - see <@U0260V1BX>'s question above ^^^
<@U026PT0D7>: Made this work, basically: <http://www.eamt.org/events/tmi2002/conference/19_watanabe.pdf>
woah, that's awesome!
It's a fascinating way to solve the problem of AI repeating itself

our task was to build a program that would take as input a web page, and output a list of simple questions a human could answer after reading the page (and vice versa: given a web address and some questions the bot should answer them).
Ohh, that's pretty neat. Very cool.
Reminds me of the 'Shakespeare bot' that I know a lot of people do, but cooler.

full answer is that we need to determine HOW we expand the wired part of the Uncorked office internet. Right now our Comcast connection comes in by the orange fridge. The lines stop half way through the big room (where you see a bunch of cat5 cable cut off in the ceiling). A good topology for internet routing would have individual runs to each place where we ultimately want them, and in the new space we're still defining that. But up until we have a hardwire in the new space, at least one, we're relying on getting wireless signal to the space. The Clear modem is in the corner to help but it is limited on bandwidth so its not a very good solve, even temporarily. Note that it only supports a few connections directly, so use the belkin router attached to it (which is probably a better wireless router by a lot anyway) <@U0260V1BX>
thanks for the update :grinning:
